title: How to Make a Wine Bottle Plant Center Piece

steps.headline: Cut clean wine bottle in half.
Cut plastic liner to fit the inside of one-half of the bottle.
steps.description: Make sure the liner blocks the neck portion of the bottle so water will remain inside the bottle instead of leaking out of the top.

steps.headline: Add potting soil to ¾ of the bottle.
steps.description: Pour soil loosely to make room for planting the vegetation.

steps.headline: Plant flowers/vegetation.
steps.description: Using your shovel, make room for the plants inside your wine bottle centerpiece. Strategically place plants in an eye pleasing design and one that will hold up well without being propped up.

steps.headline: Sprinkle centerpiece ground with decorative rocks.
steps.description: While this is optional, the rocks will help seal moisture in your centerpiece, keeping your plants healthy.

steps.headline: Glue the other half of the wine bottle to the side of the planter wine bottle.
steps.description: To add interest, add several drops of glue to the side of the wine bottle and then hold the other wine bottle half in place. Hold bottle in place until it adheres to the planter. This could take several minutes.
